content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No new structures have been successfully placed. Multiple attempts were made to position and supply a Lab at (0.5, 2.5), but none succeeded due to inventory and crafting shortcomings. Although furnaces at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) and at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0) were used for smelting processes (iron plate and copper plate production, respectively), these were retrieved for processing rather than built as new, connected structures.

ERROR TIPS
• Incorrect get_entities usage:
  – Avoid unsupported keyword arguments (such as “radius”) and ensure that the number and type of arguments match the function’s expected signature.
  – When using get_entities, validate the return value to handle cases where it may be None before iterating.
  
• Lab placement failures:
  – Verify that the lab item exists in inventory before attempting placement.
  – Confirm successful crafting of a Lab prior to any placement operations.

• Insufficient resource and sub-ingredient management in lab crafting:
  – Ensure that all required precursor items (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, copper-cables, copper-plates, etc.) are available or can be produced with the available manufacturing and smelting capabilities.
  – Monitor resource conversion processes closely to avoid shortages that prevent completion of the lab’s crafting recipe.
